intro: Verticordia preissii, commonly known as the Christmas bush, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It is characterized by its distinctive, pendulous, yellow flowers that bloom during the winter months. The plant typically grows in heathland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in a fine layer of white wax. Verticordia preissii is a member of the family Scrophulariaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens.
